title: Smile Please!
summary: This book tells the story of a little fawn named Romi who was very good at running. It shows Romi's adventures and the help he receives when he gets hurt.

texts: Little Romi the fawn was very good at running.
Romi could run faster than the rabbit.
Romi could also run faster than the elephant.
Romi crossed the little stream in one leap.
She wanted to run even faster.
Romi kept running forward without stopping.
Suddenly, Romi tripped on a rock.
She fell down with a thud.
Romi hurt her leg when she fell.
Her leg hurt so much that tears came.
A monkey came to help fix Romi's leg.
A bear came to help Romi.
Still, Romi could not stop crying.
Romi's mother came and hugged her.
"Romi, next time remember to watch where you run."

postQuestions.question: What happened to Romi when he ran?

missions.title: Tell a Story About Running or Helping
missions.description: Think about a time you ran and maybe fell, or when you helped someone. Write or draw about it.

vocabulary.definition: To catch your foot and fall down.
To have tears from sadness or pain.
To hold someone close in your arms.
